com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class DataGenerators

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.DataGenerators

  • public class DataGenerators
extends Object
    Auxiliary static methods that generate various collections of test data used by DataProviders
    Author:
    M.Vokhmentsev

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  DataGenerators.CartesianSquare
      Generates Cartesian squares of the set of operands including special values like NaN, Infinity, and -0, to form a set of operands to test binary operators on various combinations of the operands.
      (package private) static class  DataGenerators.Randoms
      The methods of this class generate random values and various random sequences, including lists of pairs of random values suitable for testing binary operations

      Takes a list of Strings and copies all the items of it into a new list, inserting null after each of them.
      static List<String> multByAllPowersOfTwo(List<String> values)
      Generates and returns a list consisting of the values from the input list multiplied by powers of two whose exponents include all combinations of bits like 0b0_1000, 0b0_1111, 0b1_0000, 0b1_1111, so that the calculation of the corresponding powers using both only a single factor from the table of powers of 2, and a product of all possible factors.

      Multiplies each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, by the given factor, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.

      Multiplies each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, by the given factor, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.

      Multiplies each of the given factors by each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.
      static List<String> sequence(BigDecimal baseValue, double startDelta, double endDelta, double step, boolean addComment)
      Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from (baseValue* (1 + startDelta * 2^-128)) to (baseValue* (1 + endDelta * 2^-128)) inclusive, with a step of (baseValue* step * 1^-128).
      static List<String> sequence(BigDecimal baseValue, double startDelta, double endDelta, double step, int exponent, boolean addComment)
      Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from ((baseValue+ startDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp) to ((baseValue+ endDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp) inclusive, with a step of (step * 2^-128 * 2^exp).
      static List<String> sequence(String baseValue, int startDelta, int endDelta)
      Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from (baseValue + (startDelta * 2^-128)) to (baseValue + (endDelta * 2^-128)) inclusive, with a step of 2^-128, which corresponds to the least significant bit of the of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple value.
      static List<String> sequences(int startDelta, int endDelta, String... baseValues)
      Generates and returns a series of sequences of form
      s[0] + sd * 2^-128,  s[0] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[0] + ed * 2^-128;
      s[1] + sd * 2^-128,  s[1] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[1] + ed * 2^-128;
      ... ;
      s[n-1] + sd * 2^-128,  s[n-1] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[n-1]+ ed * 2^-128,
      where s[0] .. s[n-1] are the elements of baseValues, sd is the value of the startDelta parameter, and ed is the value of the endDelta parameter.
      static List<String> subnormalVicinities(String[] mantissas, double addition, double maxDelta, double minDelta)
      Generates and returns a series of sequences, each of which is a number of values, successively approaching and then moving away from the base value, that is a product of a value from the mantissas list multiplied by Quadruple.MIN_VALUE; such sequences are repeated for a number of values of binary exponents within the range of subnormal Quadruple values.
      static List<String> vicinities(String[] mantissas, double addition, double maxDelta, double minDelta)
      Generates and returns a series of sequences of values, such that in each sequences the values are successively approaching and then moving away from the base value of the sequence, calculated as (m[i] + (a + delta) * 2^-128), where m[i] is an element of the mantissas array, a is the value of the addition parameter, and delta grows from -maxDelta up to -minDelta decreasing in module ten times each step, passes through 0, and then grows from minDelta up to maxDelta increasing ten times each step.

    • Method Detail

      • insertNulls

        public static List<String> insertNulls(List<String> inpList)
        Takes a list of Strings and copies all the items of it into a new list, inserting null after each of them. The resulting list looks like (v1, null, v2, null, ...), where v1, v2... are the values from the first list.
        Parameters:
        inpList - a dense list with values
        Returns:
        a new list where the values from the input list are supplemented with null items

      • insertNulls

        public static List<String> insertNulls(String header,
                                       List<String> inpList)
        Takes a list of Strings and copies all the items of it into a new list, inserting null after each of them. Additionally inserts the given header and null in the beginning of the resulting list. The resulting list looks like (h, null, v1, null, v2, null, ...), where h is the header, and v1, v2... are the values from the first list. The input list remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        header - the header to insert in the the beginning of the list
        inpList - the list to copy the values from
        Returns:
        the list that contains the header and all the items from the input list, with nulls inserted after each item

      • appendComment

        public static List<String> appendComment(List<String> list,
                                         String... comments)
        Appends the given strings to the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        list - the list to add the comments to
        comments - the comment lines to add to the list
        Returns:
        the input list with the given strings added to the end of it

      • sequence

        public static List<String> sequence(String baseValue,
                                    int startDelta,
                                    int endDelta)
        Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from (baseValue + (startDelta * 2^-128)) to (baseValue + (endDelta * 2^-128)) inclusive, with a step of 2^-128, which corresponds to the least significant bit of the of the mantissa of the corresponding Quadruple value.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - the value to add the delta to, expressed as a String
        startDelta - the factor to multiply the LSB by, to get the delta to add to the base at the first iteration
        endDelta - the factor to multiply the LSB by, to get the delta to add to the base at the last iteration
        Returns:
        a list containing the sequence of the values described above, expressed as strings

      • sequence

        public static List<String> sequence(BigDecimal baseValue,
                                    double startDelta,
                                    double endDelta,
                                    double step,
                                    boolean addComment)
        Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from (baseValue* (1 + startDelta * 2^-128)) to (baseValue* (1 + endDelta * 2^-128)) inclusive, with a step of (baseValue* step * 1^-128).
        In other words, the resulting list contains the following values:
         baseValue * (1 + (startDelta * 2^-128)),
 baseValue * (1 + (startDelta + (1 * step * 2^-128))),
 baseValue * (1 + (startDelta + (2 * step * 2^-128))),
 ...
 baseValue * (1 + (ensDelta - (1 * step * 2^-128))),
 baseValue * (1 + endDelta * 2^-128)
        Parameters:
        baseValue - a factor to multiply by the growing coefficient to get the next value of the sequence
        startDelta - addition to one, in 2^-128, to find the starting value of the the growing coefficient
        endDelta - addition to one, in 2^-128, to find the ending value of the the growing coefficient
        step - defines the difference between adjacent values, so that v1 = v0 + baseValue* step * 2^-128
        addComment - a flag signifying that comment lines with human-readable expressions should be added before each value in the sequence
        Returns:
        a list of string representations of the values described above

      • sequence

        public static List<String> sequence(BigDecimal baseValue,
                                    double startDelta,
                                    double endDelta,
                                    double step,
                                    int exponent,
                                    boolean addComment)
        Returns a list of Strings representing a sequence of values growing from ((baseValue+ startDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp) to ((baseValue+ endDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp) inclusive, with a step of (step * 2^-128 * 2^exp).
        In other words, the resulting list contains the following values:
          (baseValue + startDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp,
  (baseValue + (startDelta + 1 * step) * 2^-128) * 2^exp,
  (baseValue + (startDelta + 2 * step) * 2^-128) * 2^exp,
 ...
  (baseValue + (ensDelta - 1 * step) * 2^-128) * 2^exp,
  (baseValue + endDelta * 2^-128) * 2^exp
        Parameters:
        baseValue - a base value to add the growing addition to before raising to the power of two
        startDelta - a delta that is to be multiplied by 2^-128 before adding to sourceValue and raising to the power of two to form the starting value of the sequence
        endDelta - a delta that is to be multiplied by 2^-128 before adding to sourceValue and raising to the power of two to form the ending value of the sequence
        step - defines the difference between adjacent values, so that v1 = v0 + step * 2^-128 * 2^exp
        exponent - defines the power of two of the factor 2^exp
        addComment - a flag signifying that comment lines with human-readable expressions should be added before each value in the sequence
        Returns:
        a list of string representations of the values described above

      • sequences

        public static List<String> sequences(int startDelta,
                                     int endDelta,
                                     String... baseValues)
        Generates and returns a series of sequences of form
        s[0] + sd * 2^-128,  s[0] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[0] + ed * 2^-128;
        s[1] + sd * 2^-128,  s[1] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[1] + ed * 2^-128;
        ... ;
        s[n-1] + sd * 2^-128,  s[n-1] + (sd + 1) * 2^-128, ... s[n-1]+ ed * 2^-128,
        where s[0] .. s[n-1] are the elements of baseValues, sd is the value of the startDelta parameter, and ed is the value of the endDelta parameter.
        Parameters:
        startDelta - the starting delta, in the units of 2^-128
        endDelta - the ending delta, in the units of 2^-128
        baseValues - an array of string representations of the base values to generate the sequences
        Returns:
        a list of string representations of the values described above

      • multiply

        public static List<String> multiply(List<String> inputList,
                                    BigDecimal factor)
        Multiplies each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, by the given factor, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.
        The input list remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        inputList - a list of strings representing the values to be multiplied by the given factor
        factor - a factor to multiply the values from the inputList
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing the products

      • multiply

        public static List<String> multiply(List<String> inputList,
                                    double factor)
        Multiplies each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, by the given factor, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.
        The input list remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        inputList - a list of strings representing the values to be multiplied by the given factor
        factor - a factor to multiply the values from the inputList
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing the products

      • multiplyByFactors

        public static List<String> multiplyByFactors(List<String> inputList,
                                             double... factors)
        Multiplies each of the given factors by each of the the values, represented by the items of inputList, and returns a list containing string representations of the corresponding products.
        The resulting list contains the products in the following order: 
         v[0] * f[0], v[1] * f[0], ... v[n-1] * f[0],
 v[0] * f[1], v[1] * f[1], ... v[n-1] * f[1],
 ...
 v[0] * f[m-1], v[1] * f[m-1], ... v[n-1] * f[m-1]
        Both input arguments remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        inputList - a list of strings representing the values to be multiplied by the given factor
        factors - an array of factors to multiply the values from the inputList
        Returns:
        a list of strings expressing the products, v[0] * f[0], v[1] * f[0], ... v[n-1] * f[0], v[0] * f[1], v[1] * f[1], ... v[n-1] * f[1], ... v[0] * f[m-1], v[1] * f[m-1], ... v[n-1] * f[m-1]

      • subnormalVicinities

        public static List<String> subnormalVicinities(String[] mantissas,
                                               double addition,
                                               double maxDelta,
                                               double minDelta)
        Generates and returns a series of sequences, each of which is a number of values, successively approaching and then moving away from the base value, that is a product of a value from the mantissas list multiplied by Quadruple.MIN_VALUE; such sequences are repeated for a number of values of binary exponents within the range of subnormal Quadruple values.

        The result for maxDelta = 3e-39 and minDelta = 3e-40, for example, would look as the following:
        

 ((m * 2^e + a) - maxDelta) * MIN_VALUE,
 ((m * 2^e + a) - maxDelta / 10) * MIN_VALUE,
 ...
 ((m * 2^e + a) + maxDelta / 10) * MIN_VALUE,
 ((m * 2^e + a) + maxDelta) * MIN_VALUE,

   (0.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   (0.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
    0.5 * MIN_VALUE,
   (0.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
   (0.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,

   (1.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE
   (1.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
    1.5 * MIN_VALUE,
   (1.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
   (1.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,

   (2.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   (2.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
    2.5 * MIN_VALUE,
   (2.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
   (2.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   ...
   (32767.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   (32767.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
    32767.5 * MIN_VALUE,
   (32767.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
   (32767.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,

   (40959.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   (40959.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
    40959.5 * MIN_VALUE,
   (40959.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE,
   (40959.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE,
   ...
   (340282366920938463463374607431768211455.5 - 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE
   (340282366920938463463374607431768211455.5 - 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE
    340282366920938463463374607431768211455.5 * MIN_VALUE
   (340282366920938463463374607431768211455.5 + 3E-40) * MIN_VALUE
   (340282366920938463463374607431768211455.5 + 3E-39) * MIN_VALUE
        Used to test the precision of rounding subnormal values that are close to (n + 0.5) * 2^-2147483774, which is performed by String to Quadruple and String to Quadruple conversions.
        Parameters:
        mantissas - a number of mantissas to form the base values for the subsequences
        addition - a constant to be added to the mantissa to form the base value of the subsequence
        maxDelta - maximum magnitude of the delta to be added or subtracted to the base value before multiplying it by MIN_VALUE;
        minDelta - minimum magnitude of the delta to be added or subtracted to the base value before multiplying it by MIN_VALUE;
        Returns:
        a list of strings expressing the values described

      • vicinities

        public static List<String> vicinities(String[] mantissas,
                                      double addition,
                                      double maxDelta,
                                      double minDelta)
        Generates and returns a series of sequences of values, such that in each sequences the values are successively approaching and then moving away from the base value of the sequence, calculated as (m[i] + (a + delta) * 2^-128), where m[i] is an element of the mantissas array, a is the value of the addition parameter, and delta grows from -maxDelta up to -minDelta decreasing in module ten times each step, passes through 0, and then grows from minDelta up to maxDelta increasing ten times each step.
        For m[i] = 1.25, addition = 0.5, maxDelta = 3e-39, and minDelta = 3-40, the corresponding fragment of the resulting list would be the following: 
             1.25 + (0.5 - 3E-39) * 2^-128,
     1.25 + (0.5 - 3E-40) * 2^-128,
     1.25 +  0.5 * 2^-128,
     1.25 + (0.5 + 3E-40) * 2^-128,
     1.25 + (0.5 + 3E-39) * 2^-128,
        Used to test the precision of rounding normal values whose mantissas are close to 1 + (n + 0.5 * 2^-128), i.e. the values that differ from the exact values of the nearest Quadruple values by deltas that are close to the half of the least significant bit of the mantissa.
        Parameters:
        mantissas - a number of mantissas to form the base values for the sequence
        addition - a constant to be added to the mantissa to form the base value of the sequence, in units of the LSB of the mantissa
        maxDelta - the magnitude of the maximum difference between the base value and an element of the generated sequence, in units of the LSB of the mantissa
        minDelta - the magnitude of the minimal difference between the base value and an element of the generated sequence, in units of the LSB of the mantissa
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing the values described above

      • multByAllPowersOfTwo

        public static List<String> multByAllPowersOfTwo(List<String> values)
        Generates and returns a list consisting of the values from the input list multiplied by powers of two whose exponents include all combinations of bits like 0b0_1000, 0b0_1111, 0b1_0000, 0b1_1111, so that the calculation of the corresponding powers using both only a single factor from the table of powers of 2, and a product of all possible factors.
        The resulting list looks like the following:
        v[0] * 2^-2147483646, v[1] * 2^-2147483646, ..., v[n-1] * 2^-2147483646,
v[0] * 2^-1073741824, v[1] * 2^-1073741824, ..., v[n-1] * 2^-1073741824,
...,
v[0] * 2^-1, v[1] * 2^-1, ..., v[n-1] * 2^-1,
v[0] * 2^0, v[1] * 2^0, ..., v[n-1] * 2^0,
v[0] * 2^1, v[1] * 2^1, ..., v[n-1] * 2^1,
...,
v[0] * 2^1073741824, v[1] * 2^1073741824, ..., v[n-1] * 2^1073741824,
v[0] * 2^2147483647, v[1] * 2^2147483647, ..., v[n-1] * 2^2147483647,
        Parameters:
        values - a list of values to be multiplied by the powers of two
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing the values described above
